This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=EASTASIA-RESEARCH.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-25T22:23:08Z Tobias Hofmann 2015-02-25T15:08:12-07:00 2015-02-25T15:08:12-07:00 IPSA-NUS Methods School, Singapore, June 9-18, 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;660ee6c1.1502 The 4th Annual IPSA-NUS Summer School for Social Science Research Methods<br>will be held at the National University of Singapore, June 9-18,<br>2015.<br><br>This year's Methods School offers thirteen quantitative, qualitative, and<br>formal methods courses, such as Bayesian Analysis, Case Study Analysis,<br>Experimental Methods, Game Theory, Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Mixed<br>Methods, QCA, and Quantitative Text Analysis. All courses are taught by<br>highly experienced international faculty from the U.S. and Europe and<br>provide participants with rigorous, hands-on training in state-of-the-art<br>research methods. [...] Shin,HB 2015-02-18T15:23:33+00:00 2015-02-18T15:23:33+00:00 Border Masculinities CFP https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;214e1e2e.1502 Border Masculinities: Cross-disciplinary Dialogues and New Directions<br>Dear Colleague,<br><br>Circulating the following message upon the request from the organisers. Please kind see below.<br><br>With all best wishes,<br><br>Hyun<br><br>Message begins ============================================================<br><br>We are inviting proposals for chapters of an edited volume which consider how a focus on borders and border crossings might transform contemporary understandings of masculinities. The volume is intended to foster dialogues between a range of disciplines engaged in the analysis of cultural representations of gender. We are particularly interested in contributions from the fields of Modern Languages and Cultures, English Studies, Film Studies, History and Cultural Studies. [...] Charles Woodhead 2015-02-10T15:49:42+00:00 2015-02-10T15:49:42+00:00 From White to Yellow: The Japanese in European Racial Thought, 1300-1735 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;7db93b7f.1502 Dear EASTASIA-RESEARCH subscribers,<br>We hope you find this title of interest.<br><br>[9780773544550]From White to Yellow<br>The Japanese in European Racial Thought, 1300-1735<br>Rotem Kowner<br>"Rotem Kowner has written an extraordinary book which will be must-reading for anyone interested in Western perceptions of the Japanese from the beginning (Marco Polo's account) to the 18th century, and to anyone interested in the history of the very concept of 'race." -Gary Leupp, Department of History, Tufts University<br>"Erudite, comprehensive, and clearly-written, From White to Yellow offers the reader a panorama of the Euro-Japanese encounter in the pre-modern period that is unsurpassed in previous [...] Georgie Williams 2015-02-06T17:59:05+00:00 2015-02-06T17:59:05+00:00 26 Feb - Andrew Small \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The China-Pakistan Axis: Asia's New Geopolitics https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;2b0c74bc.1502 Dear all<br>You might be interested in the forthcoming talk by Andrew Small on his recently published book, The China-Pakistan Axis: Asia's New Geopolitics. The event details are below.<br><br>Andrew has has worked on Chinese foreign and economic policy issues in Beijing, Brussels, London, and now Washington, D.C. He is a Transatlantic Fellow at the German Marshall Fund of the United States. Progress in Asia https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;842df456.1410 CALL FOR PAPERS<br>Special Issue of Asia Pacific Business Review<br><br>‘The Role of Human Capital in Societal Progress in Asia’<br><br>This Special Issue on ‘The Role of Human Capital in Societal Progress in Asia’ will examine relevant theories, processes and practices within the Asia Pacific region to further our understanding of how these may differ within and across regions and to help managers learn how to employ these processes more effectively to help organisations be successful. In addition, this work hopes to move beyond Western paradigms and explore additional perspectives based on differing cultural foundations and develop cross-disciplinary and inter-disciplinary [...] Hyun Shin 2014-10-17T22:17:07+01:00 2014-10-17T22:17:07+01:00 Fwd: looking for a Vietnam-based researcher https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;521dc764.1410 Dear Colleague,<br><br>Please see the message from Dr Abel Polese looking for a researcher based in Vietnam for a project he is involved in.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Hyun<br><br>Dr Hyun Bang Shin<br>Associate Professor of Geography and Urban Studies<br>Department of Geography and Environment, London School of Economics<br>tel: +44 (0)20 7955 6383<br><br>Department profile: http://citiesgeographylse.net/whos-who/hyun-bang-shin/<br>Personal web: http://urbancommune.net<br>Twitter: @urbancommune<br>Academia.edu: http://lse.academia.edu/HyunShin [...] Rachel Shand 2014-10-14T12:40:19+00:00 2014-10-14T12:40:19+00:00 Anxious Wealth: Money and Morality Among China's New Rich https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;e4cecd40.1410 Stanford University Press is now represented by Combined Academic Publishers.<br><br>A special introductory discount is available below.<br><br>[Description: Description: \\\\capbiz02\\images\\9780804783545.jpg]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/anxious-wealth>Anxious Wealth<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/anxious-wealth><br><br>Money and Morality Among China's New Rich<br>John Osburg<br><br>"[Osburg's] ethnographic study of the emergence of China's new rich in the last three decades depicts and analyzes networks among elite entrepreneurs and between themselves and government officials, through which they establish alliances or even social institutions to generate, increase, and protect their wealth and social status. . . . A must have book for China studies. . . . Highly recommended."-A. Y. Lee, Choice [...] Charles Woodhead 2014-09-29T13:22:37+00:00 2014-09-29T13:22:37+00:00 Hindu-Catholic Encounters in Goa: Religious, Colonialism, and Modernity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;a66a12cc.1409 [Description: Description: \\\\capbiz02\\images\\covers\\large\\9780253012944_FChigh.jpg]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/hindu-catholic-encounters-in-goa>Hindu-Catholic Encounters in Goa<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/hindu-catholic-encounters-in-goa><br><br>Religion, Colonialism, and Modernity<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/hindu-catholic-encounters-in-goa><br>Alexander Henn<br><br>"An original, ground breaking book that shows impeccable scholarship, conceptual innovation, and a deep knowledge of the context.... It will bring fresh ways of engaging questions not only about Goa and India but also about religious pluralism, the variations in the colonial experience, and the textures of memory.... 2014-09-11T14:07:11+00:00 2014-09-11T14:07:11+00:00 Chinese Looks: Fashion, Performance, Race https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EASTASIA-RESEARCH;c1fc5032.1409 [Description: Description: 9780253012562_FChigh]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/chinese-looks>Chinese Looks<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/chinese-looks><br><br>Fashion, Performance, Race<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/chinese-looks><br>Sean Metzger<br><br>"A thoroughly researched, richly detailed study of the ways that items of clothing can both reveal and fashion cultural relationships." -SanSan Kwan, University of California, Berkeley<br><br>From yellow-face performance in the 19th century to Jackie Chan in the 21st, Chinese Looks examines articles of clothing and modes of adornment as a window on how American views of China have changed in the past 150 years. View on rowman.com Preview by Yahoo The Global Impact of South Korean Popular Culture Hallyu Unbound This volume fills a gap in the existing literature and proposes an interdisciplinary and multicultural comparative approach to the impact of Hallyu worldwide.
